intro: Cissampelos smilacina, commonly known as the creeping woodbine, is a climbing vine native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by distinctive, winged fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. Its rapid growth and ability to climb make it both a useful ornamental plant and a potential invasive species in some areas.
